name: iPath Series B S&P 500 VIX Short-Term Futures ETN
description: The iPath Series B S&P 500 VIX Short-Term Futures ETN (VXX) is an exchange-traded note designed to provide investors with exposure to VIX futures contracts, which are used to measure market volatility. Launched in 2010, VXX is linked to the S&P 500 VIX Short-Term Futures Index, which reflects the returns of a portfolio of VIX futures contracts with maturities of one month and two months. As such, VXX is often utilized by investors as a hedge against market downturns, allowing them to profit from rising volatility when market conditions become turbulent. The product is popular among traders and institutional investors seeking to manage risk and capitalize on the volatility of the equity markets. However, due to the nature of futures contracts and the structure of the ETN, VXX can be subject to contango, which can lead to significant losses over time if held for an extended period. As a result, it is generally recommended for tactical trading strategies rather than long-term investment. The VXX ETN is issued by Barclays Bank PLC and trades on major exchanges, providing liquidity and accessibility for investors looking to navigate the complexities of market volatility. It is important for investors to understand the risks associated with volatility trading and to conduct thorough research before engaging with VXX.
